file_content.text: I have my Sithspawn, you have my reward. Our business is concluded.
Yes! Magnificent. Only the dark side engenders such power, such... oh, you're still here. Will this satisfy you?
It was hardly a challenge.
That will do nicely.
Not very grateful, are you?
You did well, but my work's just begun. Leave me!
No Sithspawn yet? Why am I plagued with these constant delays?
Finally, someone who will understand. Or, maybe even assist me in my work.
Interested in a small task? It involves matching your strength against a great beast for credits.
Hmm. Yes. I could use someone with a bit of finesse. This day has been intolerable.
My idiot apprentices got themselves killed during a simple ritual, and they still have the runes I entrusted to them.
They just had to summon a dark side beast--a Sithspawn--and bring it to me. I even researched the artifact to bind it. Could you help?
Sithspawn aren't known for their gentle disposition.
That's a risky ritual.
Incompetent assistants are my greater problem. You seem different.
Summoning dark creatures sounds like Sith business.
I'm not into mystical stuff.
Once you have the artifact, even you could summon a Sithspawn.
Why would you want to summon a Sithspawn?
What's the beast for?
You're right! Why would anybody want... an incredibly powerful creature of darkness to study.
If the price is right.
Yes, yes, you'll be showered in rewards--once I have my Sithspawn.
Oh, you will need to subdue the Sithspawn before the artifact can bind it.
Just point me in the right direction, and I'll bring back your creature.
Sounds simple.
Fight a Sithspawn? No problem.
Get the runes from my apprentices' bodies, and take them to the archway in the jungle. The artifact is hidden there, it will guide you.
Well? Don't just stand there, go and get my Sithspawn.
If you really want an exotic pet, you can summon it yourself.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
I'd rather not involve myself in your little ritual.
No thanks. [Refuse quest]
Then leave. I'll find someone with a stronger backbone.
As if my apprentices' failure wasn't vexing enough. Do go away.
